preference.name: Mail_OSMail_activated
preference.preference_description: Defines if the OS Mail functionality is available. This is a site preference. Valid values are true (default) or false. When the value is false, the value given to preference "Mail_server_name" is not taken into account.

preference.name: Mail_OS_from_address
preference.preference_description: Defines a "From" e-mail address for OS notification e-mails. Valid vallues are: * a valid email address: this value appears in the e-mail header "From" line. * an empty value: the "From" email address is taken from the sender's Person definition. This is the default value.

preference.name: Mail_internal_mail_activated
preference.preference_description: Defines if Teamcenter internal mail functionality is available when using the "notify" Workflow Handler. Valid values are true or false (default). When the value is false, Teamcenter internal mail will not be sent to the user's Teamcenter mailbox. This is a site preference.

preference.name: Mail_send_file_attachments_activated
preference.preference_description: Activates the sending of Dataset attachments as normal e-mail file attachments, when the Envelope functionality is sending messages directly to an e-mail address instead of a Teamcenter user. Valid values are: * true: external recipients of e-mails will receive Dataset files as attachments, instead of Teamcenter client links to the Envelope. Furthermore, the recipient is able to open the attached files without needing a Teamcenter login or privileges. Therefore, consider site security guidelines before setting this preference to true. This is the default value. * false: external recipients of e-mails receive only Teamcenter client links to the attached Datasets, and not the actual files. When the mail is sent to a Teamcenter user, this preference has no impact, and the user will always receive links to the Envelope object.

preference.name: Mail_server_authentication_activated
preference.preference_description: Defines if the Mail sent from Teamcenter needs to be Authenticated. Valid values are: * true: The authentication will be performed while sending an email. An admin will need to update Mail_server_authentication_id, Mail_server_connection_security, Mail_server_authentication_passwd_location and Mail_server_ssl_protocol if authentication is true. * false: The email will be sent without authentication. An admin may need to update the Mail_server_port if authentication is false. This is the default value.

preference.name: Mail_server_authentication_id
preference.preference_description: Defines the email id or user id for Email Authentication. Make sure you specify the password location and email id/user id if Mail_server_authentication_activated is true.

preference.name: Mail_server_authentication_passwd_location
preference.preference_description: Defines the password location of email id used for authentication. Make sure you specify the password location and email id/user id if Mail_server_authentication_activated is true.

preference.name: Mail_server_charset
preference.preference_description: Specifies the Teamcenter mail server character set used to send OS mail.

preference.name: Mail_server_connection_security
preference.preference_description: Defines the connection security between SMTP Mail Utility (Teamcenter) and Mail Server. Valid values are: * None * SSL/TLS * STARTTLS This value depends on the Mail server configuration for SMTP.

preference.name: Mail_server_name
preference.preference_description: Information about the mail gateway server. This is a site preference. It can be set to either a mail server name or to a numeric IP address. The mail server name should be a machine running a send mail daemon. Leaving it as "your mail server machine" while the "Mail_OSMail_activated" preference is true may give you errors telling you to set this preference if you try to use the "Send" command.

preference.name: Mail_server_port
preference.preference_description: Sets the port number used by the SMTP mail server to send OS mail. This is a site preference. The default value is 25.

preference.name: Mail_server_ssl_protocol
preference.preference_description: Defines the connection security protocol between SMTP Mail Utility (Teamcenter) and Mail Server. This value depends on the Mail server configuration for SMTP. Valid values are: TLSv1, TLSv1_1, TLSv1_2, SSLv2, SSLv23, SSLv3. These are the only supported ssl/tls protocol.
